front.div:
The sensitivity of the optical reflectivity of porous silicon structures to the refractive index of liquid
within the pores is studied for a single layer, a Bragg mirror and a microcavity. Sucrose solutions of con-
centration in the range 0.05 to 1.0% by weight are introduced into the pores within a flow cell in order to
change the refractive index of the liquid in the pores from 1.3330 to 1.3344. Optimum wavelengths for
detection via reflectivity changes are determined based on a signal to noise analysis. The optical thickness
of the single layer is also monitored by measuring the fringe spacing via a Fourier transform technique. It
is just possible to detect the effect of a change in refractive index of liquid in the pores of 0.00007 for both
the reflectivity and optical thickness approaches.
